title: How to Make White Chocolate Cranberry Cookies

steps.headline: Cream the butter, brown sugar, and white sugar together in a large bowl until smooth.
Beat the egg and vanilla into the mixture.
Stir the flour and baking soda into the mix.
Add the white chocolate chips and cranberries and incorporate.
Turn out spoonfuls of the dough onto the cookie sheets.
steps.description: Make sure all cookies are a few inches apart.

steps.headline: Bake for 8 to 10 minutes.

Transfer the cookies to wire racks and allow them to cool completely.

text: Preheat your oven to 375℉ (190℃).  Grease your cookie sheet(s).  Cream the butter, brown sugar, and white sugar together in a large bowl until smooth.  Beat the egg and vanilla into the mixture.  Stir the flour and baking soda into the mix.  Add the white chocolate chips and cranberries and incorporate.  Turn out spoonfuls of the dough onto the cookie sheets. Make sure all cookies are a few inches apart. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes. For best results, remove the cookies from the oven while they are still doughy. Allow the cookies to cool for about a minute while still on the cookie sheets.  Transfer the cookies to wire racks and allow them to cool completely.  Serve the cookies and enjoy!
